target_translation: vô cùng hạnh phúc / ngây ngất
source_translation: feeling or expressing overwhelming happiness or joyful excitement
example: She was ecstatic when she found out she had been accepted into her dream university.

source_translation: a feeling of pensive sadness, typically with no obvious cause
example: The rainy weather always puts him in a melancholy mood.

source_translation: feeling annoyed or less confident because you cannot achieve what you want
example: I feel very frustrated when my computer keeps freezing while I'm working.

target_translation: mâu thuẫn / vừa yêu vừa ghét
source_translation: having mixed feelings or contradictory ideas about something or someone
example: He has an ambivalent attitude toward his job; he likes the salary but hates the commute.

source_translation: in a state of peaceful happiness and satisfaction
example: After a long day of work, sitting by the fireplace made her feel perfectly content.

source_translation: feeling a sudden strong emotion or having too much to deal with
example: The staff were overwhelmed by the number of complaints they received.

source_translation: anxious or fearful that something bad or unpleasant will happen
example: I'm a bit apprehensive about the surgery tomorrow.

source_translation: feeling a sentimental longing or wistful affection for the past
example: Looking at old family photos makes me feel very nostalgic.

source_translation: feeling or showing anger or annoyance at what is perceived as unfair treatment
example: He was indignant at the suggestion that he had cheated.

source_translation: showing an ability to understand and share the feelings of another
example: A good therapist must be empathetic and non-judgmental.

target_translation: vô cùng hạnh phúc / lên tận tầng mây
source_translation: to be extremely happy and excited
example: He's been on cloud nine ever since he got the promotion.

source_translation: feeling unhappy or without much hope
example: She’s been a bit down in the dumps since her best friend moved away.

source_translation: having both positive and negative feelings about something at the same time
example: I have mixed emotions about moving; I'm excited for the new job but sad to leave my family.

source_translation: to deliberately not allow yourself to show or talk about your feelings
example: It’s not healthy to bottle up your anger; you should talk to someone.

target_translation: bực đến phát điên / hết kiên nhẫn
source_translation: intensely irritated and frustrated
example: The teacher gave an exasperated sigh when the students refused to listen.

source_translation: feeling unprotected and exposed to the possibility of being attacked or harmed, either physically or emotionally
example: Sharing your personal story makes you feel vulnerable, but it builds trust.

source_translation: to suddenly become very angry or upset and stop being calm
example: I’m usually a patient person, but I really lost my cool when he lied to me.

source_translation: able to withstand or recover quickly from difficult conditions
example: Children are often more resilient than we give them credit for.

source_translation: to have a very strong feeling of happiness
example: They were bursting with joy when their first grandchild was born.

source_translation: greatly dismayed or horrified
example: I was appalled by the lack of hygiene in the restaurant kitchen.

source_translation: feeling or expressing bitterness or indignation at having been treated unfairly
example: He felt deeply resentful that his younger brother inherited the entire estate.

source_translation: extremely jealous of someone else's possessions or success
example: When she saw my new car, she was absolutely green with envy.

target_translation: bị giày vò bởi tội lỗi
source_translation: filled with a sense of guilt
example: She felt guilt-ridden after forgetting her mother's birthday for the second year in a row.

target_translation: tự ti / e dè (vì lo người khác nhìn mình)
source_translation: feeling undue awareness of oneself, one's appearance, or one's actions
example: I felt very self-conscious walking into the party wearing casual clothes while everyone else was in formal wear.

target_translation: làm ai đó sôi máu / cực kỳ tức giận
source_translation: to cause someone to become extremely angry
example: The way they treat their animals just makes my blood boil.

source_translation: sad because one has no friends or company
example: Moving to a new city can be very lonely at first.

target_translation: vô cùng sung sướng / sướng rơn
source_translation: extremely happy or delighted
example: They were over the moon when they won the lottery.

source_translation: having no particular interest or sympathy; unconcerned
example: He was strangely indifferent to the news of his own promotion.

source_translation: a feeling of relief from a burden or worry
example: Finally telling her the truth was a huge weight off my shoulders.
collocations: feel like a weight off my shoulders

target_translation: sợ cứng người / sợ chết khiếp
source_translation: extremely frightened to the point where you cannot move
example: I'm scared stiff of heights, so I won't go up the Eiffel Tower.

term: wear one's heart on one's sleeve
target_translation: ruột để ngoài da / không giấu giếm cảm xúc
source_translation: to make your feelings and emotions obvious to other people
example: You always know how Sarah feels; she wears her heart on her sleeve.

target_translation: tan nát / hoàn toàn sụp đổ
source_translation: extremely upset and shocked
example: The family was devastated by the sudden loss of their home in the fire.

target_translation: sợ chết trân / sợ đến mức hóa đá
source_translation: so frightened that one is unable to move; terrified
example: I was petrified when I saw the snake slithering across the floor.

target_translation: bồn chồn / đứng ngồi không yên
source_translation: in a state of nervous anticipation or anxiety
example: We were on pins and needles waiting for the test results.

target_translation: sửng sốt / kinh ngạc tột độ
source_translation: greatly surprised or astonished
example: I was flabbergasted when he told me how much the house actually cost.

target_translation: ngơ ngác / lúng túng / hoang mang
source_translation: confused and indecisive; puzzled
example: He looked bewildered by the complex instructions I gave him.

target_translation: làm ai đó bất ngờ / đánh úp
source_translation: to surprise someone by happening when they are not expecting it
example: The sudden heavy rain took us by surprise during our picnic.

target_translation: bồn chồn / run rẩy (vì lo lắng)
source_translation: feeling nervous or uneasy, often accompanied by small physical movements
example: I always feel a bit jittery before giving a public speech.

target_translation: chết lặng / không thốt nên lời
source_translation: so greatly astonished or amazed that one is unable to speak
example: The news of the scandal left the entire audience dumbfounded.

source_translation: a feeling that something bad is happening or will happen
example: I had a sinking feeling in my stomach when I saw the police car outside.

source_translation: feeling or showing sudden shock or alarm
example: A loud bang in the street startled me while I was sleeping.

source_translation: tense, nervous, or irritable
example: Everyone at the office has been on edge since the announcement of the layoffs.

target_translation: cực kỳ giận dữ / phát tiết
source_translation: extremely angry and impatient
example: I was infuriated by the company's refusal to take responsibility for the error.

source_translation: very unhappy or uncomfortable
example: The cold, rainy weather made everyone feel miserable during the camping trip.

target_translation: giận đỏ mặt / mất kiểm soát vì giận
source_translation: to become very angry suddenly
example: When he saw the man hit the dog, he just saw red.

source_translation: suffering from overwhelming distress; very upset
example: He was heartbroken when his cat passed away after fifteen years.

term: at the end of one's tether
source_translation: having no patience or energy left to cope with a difficult situation
example: With the baby crying and the house in a mess, she was at the end of her tether.
collocations: be at the end of one's tether
synonyms: at the end of one's rope

source_translation: in low spirits from loss of hope or courage
example: She grew despondent after her third job application was rejected.

target_translation: nổi trận lôi đình / giận dữ
source_translation: to lose one's temper and explode with anger
example: My dad blew his top when he saw the dent in his new car.

target_translation: vừa ngọt ngào vừa cay đắng
source_translation: arousing pleasure tinged with sadness or pain
example: Graduation was a bittersweet moment; I was happy to finish but sad to leave my friends.

source_translation: bitter indignation at having been treated unfairly
example: She felt a flicker of resentment when her colleague got the credit for her idea.

source_translation: furiously angry
example: He was absolutely livid when he found out they had lied to him.

source_translation: confident in one's own abilities or character
example: She walked into the interview feeling self-assured and ready to answer any question.

source_translation: to have a big smile because you are very proud of something
example: The parents were beaming with pride as their daughter received her diploma.

source_translation: hopeful and confident about the future or the success of something
example: Despite the setbacks, the team remains optimistic about winning the championship.

target_translation: được tiếp thêm sức mạnh / làm chủ bản thân
source_translation: feeling stronger and more confident, especially in controlling one's life and claiming one's rights
example: The workshop was designed to make women feel empowered in the workplace.

source_translation: feeling pleasure or satisfaction, especially because of an achievement or receiving something desired
example: I was gratified to see that my hard work had finally paid off.

target_translation: vui vẻ / sôi nổi / lạc quan
source_translation: cheerful and optimistic
example: He was in a buoyant mood after hearing the good news.

source_translation: a feeling of satisfaction when you have done something difficult or important
example: Finishing the marathon gave her a huge sense of accomplishment.

source_translation: calm, peaceful, and untroubled; tranquil
example: She looked serene as she meditated by the lake.

source_translation: having or showing intense and eager enjoyment, interest, or approval
example: The audience gave the performers an enthusiastic standing ovation.

target_translation: vô cùng hạnh phúc / sướng rơn
source_translation: to feel extremely happy and excited, as if one is floating
example: After he proposed and she said yes, he was walking on air for days.

source_translation: showing or feeling no interest, enthusiasm, or concern
example: Young people are often accused of being apathetic about local politics.

target_translation: kiệt quệ / hết sạch năng lượng
source_translation: depleted of vitality or strength; extremely tired
example: I felt emotionally drained after the long and difficult conversation with my boss.

target_translation: lờ đờ / vô hồn / thiếu sức sống
source_translation: lacking energy or enthusiasm to do anything
example: The illness left her feeling listless and unable to concentrate on her studies.

source_translation: annoyed or bored with something that you have been experiencing for too long
example: I'm fed up with this constant rain; I need some sunshine!

target_translation: hờ hững / vô tâm / bình thản (đến mức lạnh lùng)
source_translation: feeling or appearing casually calm and relaxed; not displaying anxiety, interest, or enthusiasm
example: He gave a nonchalant shrug when I asked him if he was worried about the exam.

source_translation: extremely bored
example: To be honest, I was bored to tears by that three-hour documentary.

target_translation: chán chường / mệt mỏi (vì đã trải qua quá nhiều)
source_translation: tired, bored, or lacking enthusiasm, typically after having had too much of something
example: After ten years in the industry, he had become a bit jaded about the whole process.

source_translation: to feel too sorry for someone to do something that will upset them
example: I didn't have the heart to tell him that his singing was terrible.

source_translation: showing smug or uncritical satisfaction with oneself or one's achievements
example: We cannot afford to become complacent about our success; our competitors are catching up.

target_translation: hôn trầm / lờ đờ / mệt mỏi
source_translation: affected by lethargy; sluggish and apathetic
example: The hot weather makes me feel very lethargic and unmotivated.

source_translation: feeling or showing sympathy and concern for others who are suffering
example: He is a compassionate person who spends his weekends volunteering at the shelter.

source_translation: readily feeling or showing fondness or tenderness
example: She is very affectionate with her children, always giving them hugs.

target_translation: có lòng thương cảm / sự ưu ái đặc biệt cho ai đó
source_translation: to feel a lot of affection for a particular person or thing
example: I've always had a soft spot for my youngest nephew.

source_translation: a serious and honest conversation between two people about their feelings
example: We had a long heart-to-heart talk and finally cleared up the misunderstanding.

source_translation: strongly attracted to someone or something
example: He was completely smitten with her from the moment they met.

source_translation: the ability to understand and share the feelings of another
example: Teachers need to have a lot of empathy for their students' struggles.

target_translation: bị xa lánh / bị cô lập
source_translation: feeling that you do not belong in a particular group or place
example: The new student felt alienated because he didn't speak the local language.

source_translation: having an intense but short-lived passion or admiration for someone
example: She was infatuated with the pop star and had posters of him all over her room.

source_translation: the recognition and enjoyment of the good qualities of someone or something
example: I want to express my deep appreciation for all your help during the move.

source_translation: a strong wish for something or someone that is difficult or impossible to get
example: He felt a deep longing to return to his home country.

target_translation: cảm giác / năng lượng (của một người/nơi)
source_translation: a person's emotional state or the atmosphere of a place as communicated to others
example: I didn't like the vibe of that coffee shop; it felt very unfriendly.

source_translation: feeling angry, jealous, and resentful because you think you have been treated unfairly
example: She was still bitter about the way her marriage had ended.

target_translation: sự tận tâm / lòng trung thành
source_translation: love, loyalty, or enthusiasm for a person, activity, or cause
example: His devotion to his work is truly admirable.

source_translation: deep regret or guilt for a wrong committed
example: The prisoner showed no remorse for the crimes he had committed.

source_translation: emotionally or physically disturbed or upset
example: She was visibly shaken after the car accident, even though she wasn't hurt.

source_translation: showing gentleness and concern or sympathy
example: He gave her a tender kiss on the forehead before leaving.

source_translation: to look very happy and healthy
example: The bride was absolutely glowing with happiness as she walked down the aisle.

source_translation: a state of physical ease and freedom from pain or constraint; the easing of a person's feelings
example: The kind words from her friends brought her much comfort after her loss.
